Outcomes: Follow two- and three-step oral instructions in familiar contexts.
Identify the main idea and supporting details from short oral texts.
Retell short stories in correct sequence using learners’ own words.
Ask and answer simple questions appropriately in conversations.
Describe familiar things using clear descriptive language.
Use correct pronunciation and simple sentence structures in speech.
Read short passages aloud fluently with correct expression.
Answer literal and simple inferential questions from texts.
Determine word meanings using context and give synonyms/antonyms.
Read and recite short poems, identifying rhyme and rhythm.
Use a simple dictionary to find meanings and spellings.
Identify and use definite and indefinite articles appropriately in different contexts.
Identify and use regular and irregular nouns in their plural forms.
Identify and use personal and possessive pronouns as subjects and objects.
Use regular and irregular adjectives to describe and compare things.
Distinguish and use adverbs of manner, time, and place.
Identify and use conjunctions in sentences and dialogues.
Identify and use interrogative sentences appropriately.
Identify and use prepositions of position and direction.
Identify and use present and past perfect tenses.
Select and use quantifiers appropriately.
Write guided compositions such as filling forms, friendly letters, and SMS.
Write narrative and descriptive compositions of 60-100 words.
Write legibly and neatly, applying correct spelling.
Identify and use commas, question marks, and other punctuation for clarity.
Spell commonly misspelt words correctly and use double consonants.
